title.en: House of King Goujian of Yue
title.raw: 《越王句踐世家》 House of King Goujian of Yue

sentences.zh: 越王句踐，其先禹之苗裔，而夏后帝少康之庶子也。

translations.literal: Yue wang Gou Jian, his ancestors Yu's descendants, but Xia Hou Di Shao Kang's concubine son.
translations.idiomatic: Yue wang Gou Jian's ancestors were Yu's descendants, and he was Xia Hou Di Shao Kang's concubine son.

sentences.zh: 封於會稽，以奉守禹之祀。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed at Kui Ji, to serve and guard Yu's sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: He was enfeoffed at Kui Ji to serve and guard Yu's sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 文身斷發，披草萊而邑焉。

translations.literal: They tattooed their bodies and cut their hair, cleared the grassy wilds and established cities there.
translations.idiomatic: They tattooed their bodies and cropped their hair, cleared the wild grasslands and built settlements there.

sentences.zh: 後二十餘世，至於允常。

translations.literal: After more than twenty generations, it reached Yun Chang.
translations.idiomatic: After more than twenty generations, it came to King Yun Chang.

sentences.zh: 允常之時，與吳王闔廬戰而相怨伐。

translations.literal: Yun Chang's time, with Wu wang He Lu battled and mutually resented attacked.
translations.idiomatic: During Yun Chang's time, they battled with Wu wang He Lu and mutually resented and attacked each other.

sentences.zh: 允常卒，子句踐立，是為越王。

translations.literal: Yun Chang died, and his son Gou Jian was established. This was the Yue wang.
translations.idiomatic: When Yun Chang died, his son Goujian ascended the throne, becoming King of Yue.

sentences.zh: 元年，吳王闔廬聞允常死，乃興師伐越。

translations.literal: In the first year, Wu wang He Lu heard that Yun Chang had died and then raised troops to attack Yue.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of his reign, King Helü of Wu heard that Yun Chang had died and raised an army to attack Yue.

sentences.zh: 越王句踐使死士挑戰，三行，至吳陳，呼而自剄。

translations.literal: Yue wang Gou Jian sent death soldiers to challenge battle. In three rows, they reached the Wu battle lines, called out, and slit their own throats.
translations.idiomatic: King Goujian of Yue sent suicide troops to provoke battle. In three formations, they advanced to the Wu lines, shouted their defiance, and slit their own throats.

sentences.zh: 吳師觀之，越因襲擊吳師，吳師敗於檇李，射傷吳王闔廬。

translations.literal: The Wu troops watched this. Yue therefore raided and attacked the Wu troops. The Wu troops were defeated at Gui Li, and Wu wang He Lu was shot and injured.
translations.idiomatic: The Wu troops stood watching in shock. Yue seized the moment to launch a surprise attack. The Wu army was defeated at Guiji, and King Helü was wounded by an arrow.

sentences.zh: 闔廬且死，告其子夫差曰：「必毋忘越。」

translations.literal: He Lu about to die, told his son Fu Chai said: 'Certainly do not forget Yue.'
translations.idiomatic: He Lu was about to die. He told his son Fu Chai: 'You must certainly not forget Yue.'

sentences.zh: 三年，句踐聞吳王夫差日夜勒兵，且以報越，越欲先吳未發往伐之。

translations.literal: In the third year, Gou Jian heard that Wu wang Fu Chai drilled troops day and night, moreover intending to repay Yue. Yue desired to attack it before Wu had not yet moved.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Goujian learned that King Fuchai of Wu was drilling his troops day and night, preparing to avenge himself on Yue. Yue wanted to strike first before Wu could mobilize.

sentences.zh: 范蠡諫曰：「不可。

translations.literal: Fan Li admonished said: 'Not possible.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li admonished: 'Not possible.

sentences.zh: 臣聞兵者凶器也，戰者逆德也，爭者事之末也。

translations.literal: I have heard that weapons are inauspicious instruments, battle is contrary to virtue, and contending is the end of affairs.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that weapons are instruments of ill omen, warfare runs counter to virtue, and contention is the last resort of governance.

sentences.zh: 陰謀逆德，好用凶器，試身於所末，上帝禁之，行者不利。」

translations.literal: Secret plots contrary virtue, fond of using inauspicious instruments, test body at affairs end, Shang Di forbids it, doers unfavorable.'
translations.idiomatic: Secret plots are contrary to virtue, fond of using inauspicious instruments, testing the body at the end of affairs. Shang Di forbids it, and those who do it are unfavorable.'

sentences.zh: 越王曰：「吾已決之矣。」

translations.literal: Yue wang said: 'I have already decided it.'
translations.idiomatic: The Yue wang said: 'I have already decided it.'

sentences.zh: 遂興師。

translations.literal: They then raised troops.
translations.idiomatic: They raised an army.

sentences.zh: 吳王聞之，悉發精兵擊越，敗之夫椒。

translations.literal: The Wu wang heard it and sent all his elite troops to attack Yue, defeating them at Fu Jiao.
translations.idiomatic: When King Fuchai of Wu heard this, he deployed all his crack troops against Yue and defeated them at Mount Fujiao.

sentences.zh: 越王乃以餘兵五千人保棲於會稽。

translations.literal: The Yue wang then defended with his remaining five thousand troops, perched at Kui Ji.
translations.idiomatic: King Goujian retreated with his remaining five thousand troops to defend the heights of Mount Kuaiji.

sentences.zh: 吳王追而圍之。

translations.literal: The Wu wang pursued and surrounded them.
translations.idiomatic: King Fuchai pursued them and laid siege.

sentences.zh: 越王謂范蠡曰：「以不聽子故至於此，為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Yue wang told Fan Li said: 'Because not listened to you therefore reached this, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: The Yue wang told Fan Li: 'Because I did not listen to you, I have reached this point. What is to be done?'

sentences.zh: 蠡對曰：「持滿者與天，定傾者與人，節事者以地。

translations.literal: Li replied said: 'Hold full with heaven, settle leaning with people, moderate affairs with earth.
translations.idiomatic: Li replied: 'Those who hold fullness do so with heaven. Those who settle leaning do so with people. Those who moderate affairs do so with earth.

sentences.zh: 卑辭厚禮以遺之，不許，而身與之市。」

translations.literal: Humble words thick gifts to send them, if not permitted, then body with them bargain.'
translations.idiomatic: Send humble words and thick gifts. If not permitted, then bargain with your body.'

sentences.zh: 句踐曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Gou Jian said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: Goujian replied: 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 乃令大夫種行成於吳，膝行頓首曰：「君王亡臣句踐使陪臣種敢告下執事：句踐請為臣，妻為妾。」

translations.literal: Then commanded grandee Zhong go make peace with Wu, knee walked kowtowed said: 'Lord wang fugitive minister Gou Jian sends attendant minister Zhong dare inform lower servants: Gou Jian requests to be minister, wife to be concubine.'
translations.idiomatic: He then commanded Grandee Zhong to go make peace with Wu. He knee-walked and kowtowed, saying: 'Lord wang, your fugitive minister Gou Jian sends attendant minister Zhong to dare inform the lower servants: Gou Jian requests to be your minister, and his wife to be your concubine.'

sentences.zh: 吳王將許之。

translations.literal: The Wu wang was about to permit it.
translations.idiomatic: King Fuchai was about to agree.

sentences.zh: 子胥言於吳王曰：「天以越賜吳，勿許也。」

translations.literal: Zi Xu spoke to Wu wang said: 'Heaven with Yue grants Wu, do not permit.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xu spoke to the Wu wang: 'Heaven grants Yue to Wu. Do not permit it.'

sentences.zh: 種還，以報句踐。

translations.literal: Zhong returned to report to Gou Jian.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li returned and reported this to Goujian.

sentences.zh: 句踐欲殺妻子，燔寶器，觸戰以死。

translations.literal: Gou Jian desired to kill his wife and children, burn the treasure vessels, and fight to the death.
translations.idiomatic: Goujian wanted to kill his wife and children, burn his treasures, and fight to the last man.

sentences.zh: 種止句踐曰：「夫吳太宰嚭貪，可誘以利，請閒行言之。」

translations.literal: Zhong stopped Gou Jian said: 'Indeed Wu grand administrator Pi greedy, can lure with profit, please secretly go speak it.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhong stopped Gou Jian: 'Indeed Wu's grand administrator Pi is greedy. He can be lured with profit. Please go secretly and speak of it.'

sentences.zh: 於是句踐以美女寶器令種閒獻吳太宰嚭。

translations.literal: Thereupon Gou Jian commanded Zhong to secretly offer beautiful women and treasure vessels to Wu's grand administrator Pi.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Goujian instructed Fan Li to secretly present beautiful women and precious treasures to Wu Zixu, the Grand Administrator of Wu.

sentences.zh: 嚭受，乃見大夫種於吳王。

translations.literal: Pi accepted and then presented Grandee Zhong to the Wu wang.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zixu accepted them and presented Fan Li to King Fuchai.

sentences.zh: 種頓首言曰：「願大王赦句踐之罪，盡入其寶器。

translations.literal: Zhong kowtowed spoke said: 'Wish great wang pardon Gou Jian's crime, all enter his treasure vessels.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong kowtowed and spoke: 'I wish the great wang to pardon Gou Jian's crime and accept all his treasure vessels.

sentences.zh: 不幸不赦，句踐將盡殺其妻子，燔其寶器，悉五千人觸戰，必有當也。」

translations.literal: If unfortunately not pardoned, Gou Jian will completely kill his wife children, burn his treasure vessels, all five thousand fight to death, certainly have resistance.'
translations.idiomatic: If unfortunately not pardoned, Gou Jian will completely kill his wife and children, burn his treasure vessels, and all five thousand will fight to the death. There will certainly be resistance.'

sentences.zh: 嚭因說吳王曰：「越以服為臣，若將赦之，此國之利也。」

translations.literal: Pi therefore persuaded Wu wang said: 'Yue with submission as minister, if will pardon them, this state profit.'
translations.idiomatic: Pi therefore persuaded the Wu wang: 'Yue submits to be minister. If you pardon them, this is the state's profit.'

sentences.zh: 吳王將許之。

translations.literal: The Wu wang was about to permit it.
translations.idiomatic: King Fuchai was about to agree.

sentences.zh: 子胥進諫曰：「今不滅越，後必悔之。

translations.literal: Zi Xu advanced admonished said: 'Now not extinguish Yue, later certainly regret it.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xu advanced and admonished: 'If you do not extinguish Yue now, you will certainly regret it later.

sentences.zh: 句踐賢君，種、蠡良臣，若反國，將為亂。」

translations.literal: Gou Jian worthy lord, Zhong, Li good ministers, if return country, will cause chaos.'
translations.idiomatic: Gou Jian is a worthy lord. Zhong and Li are good ministers. If they return to their country, they will cause chaos.'

sentences.zh: 吳王弗聽，卒赦越，罷兵而歸。

translations.literal: The Wu wang did not listen. He finally pardoned Yue, dismissed the troops, and returned.
translations.idiomatic: King Fuchai would not listen to advice. In the end he pardoned Yue, disbanded his army, and returned home.

sentences.zh: 句踐之困會稽也，喟然嘆曰：「吾終於此乎？」

translations.literal: Gou Jian when distressed at Kui Ji, sighed deeply said: 'I end here?'
translations.idiomatic: When Gou Jian was distressed at Kui Ji, he sighed deeply: 'Do I end here?'

sentences.zh: 種曰：「湯系夏臺，文王囚羑里，晉重耳奔翟，齊小白奔莒，其卒王霸。

translations.literal: Zhong said: 'Tang bound Xia Tai, Wen Wang imprisoned You Li, Jin Chong Er fled Di, Qi Xiao Bai fled Ju, they finally became wang hegemon.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong said: 'Tang was bound at Xia Tai, Wen Wang was imprisoned at You Li, Jin Chong Er fled to Di, Qi Xiao Bai fled to Ju. They finally became wang and hegemon.

sentences.zh: 由是觀之，何遽不為福乎？」

translations.literal: From this observe, why hastily not become fortune?'
translations.idiomatic: From this observation, why would it hastily not become fortune?'

sentences.zh: 吳既赦越，越王句踐反國，乃苦身焦思，置膽於坐，坐臥即仰膽，飲食亦嘗膽也。

translations.literal: Wu had already pardoned Yue. Yue wang Gou Jian returned to his country. He then tormented his body with worried thoughts, placed gall at his seat, raised the gall when sitting or lying, and tasted gall when eating or drinking.
translations.idiomatic: Once Wu had pardoned Yue, King Goujian returned to his kingdom. He tormented himself with bitter thoughts, placing a gall bladder at his seat. Whether sitting or lying down, he would look up at it; whether eating or drinking, he would taste its bitterness.

sentences.zh: 曰：「女忘會稽之恥邪？」

translations.literal: Said: 'You forget Kui Ji shame?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Do you forget the shame of Kui Ji?'

sentences.zh: 身自耕作，夫人自織，食不加肉，衣不重采，折節下賢人，厚遇賓客，振貧弔死，與百姓同其勞。

translations.literal: He personally farmed with his body, his lady personally wove. Food did not add meat, clothing did not repeat colors. He bent his conduct to humble himself before worthy people, thickly treated guests, aided the poor and condoled the dead, sharing labor with the common people.
translations.idiomatic: He worked the fields himself, his queen wove cloth herself. He ate no meat, wore no bright colors. He humbled himself before the worthy, treated guests generously, aided the poor and mourned the dead, sharing in the people's labors.

sentences.zh: 欲使范蠡治國政，蠡對曰：「兵甲之事，種不如蠡；

translations.literal: Desired make Fan Li govern state affairs, Li replied said: 'Armor weapons matters, Zhong not as good as Li;
translations.idiomatic: He desired to make Fan Li govern state affairs. Li replied: 'In matters of armor and weapons, Zhong is not as good as Li;

sentences.zh: 填撫國家，親附百姓，蠡不如種。」

translations.literal: Fill pacify state, intimately attach common people, Li not as good as Zhong.'
translations.idiomatic: In filling and pacifying the state, intimately attaching the common people, Li is not as good as Zhong.'

sentences.zh: 於是舉國政屬大夫種，而使范蠡與大夫柘稽行成，為質於吳。

translations.literal: Thereupon all state affairs were entrusted to Grandee Zhong, and Fan Li was sent with Grandee Zhe Ji to make peace, serving as hostage in Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he entrusted all state affairs to Fan Li, and sent Wen Zhong with him to negotiate peace, remaining as hostages in Wu.

sentences.zh: 二歲而吳歸蠡。

translations.literal: After two years, Wu returned Li.
translations.idiomatic: After two years, Wu released Fan Li.

sentences.zh: 句踐自會稽歸七年，拊循其士民，欲用以報吳。

translations.literal: Seven years after Gou Jian returned from Kui Ji, he stroked and followed his officers and people, desiring to use them to repay Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Seven years after returning from Mount Kuaiji, Goujian nurtured his officers and people, preparing to use them to avenge himself on Wu.

sentences.zh: 大夫逢同諫曰：「國新流亡，今乃復殷給，繕飾備利，吳必懼，懼則難必至。

translations.literal: Grandee Feng Tong admonished said: 'State newly fled perished, now then again abundant provided, repaired decorated prepared sharp, Wu certainly fear, fear then disaster certainly arrive.
translations.idiomatic: Grandee Feng Tong admonished: 'The state has newly experienced flight and perishing. Now it is again abundantly provided. Repaired and decorated, prepared with sharp weapons. Wu will certainly fear. When they fear, disaster will certainly arrive.

sentences.zh: 且鷙鳥之擊也，必匿其形。

translations.literal: Moreover, when a fierce bird strikes, it certainly hides its form.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, when a fierce bird of prey strikes, it hides its form until the moment comes.

sentences.zh: 今夫吳兵加齊、晉，怨深於楚、越，名高天下，實害周室，德少而功多，必淫自矜。

translations.literal: Now Wu's troops are added to Qi and Jin. Its resentment is deep with Chu and Yue. Its name is high in the world, but in substance it harms the Zhou chamber. Virtue is few but merit is many. It will certainly lewdly self-praise.
translations.idiomatic: Now Wu has joined forces with Qi and Jin. It has deep grudges against Chu and Yue. Its reputation soars, but it undermines the Zhou house. Its merits outstrip its virtues—it will surely grow arrogant and self-congratulatory.

sentences.zh: 為越計，莫若結齊，親楚，附晉，以厚吳。

translations.literal: For Yue's plan, nothing is better than allying with Qi, befriending Chu, attaching to Jin, to enrich Wu.
translations.idiomatic: For Yue's strategy, nothing is better than allying with Qi, befriending Chu, and attaching ourselves to Jin—in order to strengthen Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳之志廣，必輕戰。

translations.literal: Wu's ambitions are broad. It will certainly battle lightly.
translations.idiomatic: Wu's ambitions are vast—it will surely grow reckless in battle.

sentences.zh: 是我連其權，三國伐之，越承其弊，可克也。」

translations.literal: This connects its authority, three states attack it, Yue receives its exhaustion, can conquer.'
translations.idiomatic: This connects its authority. Three states attack it. Yue receives its exhaustion. It can be conquered.'

sentences.zh: 句踐曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Gou Jian said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: Goujian said: 'Excellent.'

sentences.zh: 居二年，吳王將伐齊。

translations.literal: After two years, the Wu wang was about to attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Two years later, King Fuchai prepared to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 子胥諫曰：「未可。

translations.literal: Zi Xu admonished said: 'Not yet possible.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xu admonished: 'Not yet possible.

sentences.zh: 臣聞句踐食不重味，與百姓同苦樂。

translations.literal: I have heard that Gou Jian eats no repeated flavors and shares bitterness and joy with the common people.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that Goujian eats simple fare and shares in the people's joys and sorrows.

sentences.zh: 此人不死，必為國患。

translations.literal: If this person does not die, he will certainly become a state calamity.
translations.idiomatic: If this man is not killed, he will surely become a disaster for our state.

sentences.zh: 吳有越，腹心之疾，齊與吳，疥癬也。

translations.literal: Wu having Yue is an abdomen and heart illness. Qi with Wu is scabies and ringworm.
translations.idiomatic: Yue is a disease in Wu's vitals, while Qi is merely a skin rash.

sentences.zh: 願王釋齊先越。」

translations.literal: Wish wang release Qi first Yue.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish the wang to release Qi and attack Yue first.'

sentences.zh: 吳王弗聽，遂伐齊，敗之艾陵，虜齊高、國以歸。

translations.literal: The Wu wang did not listen. He then attacked Qi, defeated them at Ai Ling, captured Qi Gao and Guo, and returned.
translations.idiomatic: King Fuchai would not listen. He attacked Qi anyway, defeated them at Ailing, captured the lords of Gao and Guo, and returned in triumph.

sentences.zh: 讓子胥。

translations.literal: He blamed Zi Xu.
translations.idiomatic: He blamed Wu Zixu.

sentences.zh: 子胥曰：「王毋喜！」

translations.literal: Zi Xu said: 'Wang do not rejoice!'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xu said: 'Wang, do not rejoice!'

sentences.zh: 王怒，子胥欲自殺，王聞而止之。

translations.literal: The wang was angered. Zi Xu desired suicide. The wang heard and stopped him.
translations.idiomatic: The king was furious. Wu Zixu wanted to commit suicide, but the king heard of it and prevented him.

sentences.zh: 越大夫種曰：「臣觀吳王政驕矣，請試嘗之貸粟，以卜其事。」

translations.literal: Yue grandee Zhong said: 'Minister observes Wu wang governance arrogant, please test try lend grain, to divine its affairs.'
translations.idiomatic: Yue grandee Zhong said: 'I observe the Wu wang's governance is arrogant. Please test by requesting to borrow grain to divine his affairs.'

sentences.zh: 請貸，吳王欲與，子胥諫勿與，王遂與之，越乃私喜。

translations.literal: They requested to borrow. The Wu wang desired to give. Zi Xu admonished not to give. The wang then gave it. Yue then privately rejoiced.
translations.idiomatic: They asked for grain. King Fuchai wanted to give it to them. Wu Zixu advised against it, but the king gave it anyway. Yue secretly rejoiced.

sentences.zh: 子胥言曰：「王不聽諫，後三年吳其墟乎！」

translations.literal: Zi Xu spoke said: 'Wang not listen admonition, later three years Wu perhaps ruins!'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xu spoke: 'The wang does not listen to admonition. In three years Wu will perhaps be ruins!'

sentences.zh: 太宰嚭聞之，乃數與子胥爭越議，因讒子胥曰：「伍員貌忠而實忍人，其父兄不顧，安能顧王？

translations.literal: Grand administrator Pi heard it, then frequently with Zi Xu contended Yue discussions, therefore slandered Zi Xu said: 'Wu Yuan appearance loyal but substance cruel person, his father elder brother not cared for, how can care for wang?
translations.idiomatic: Grand administrator Pi heard it and then frequently contended with Zi Xu over Yue discussions. Therefore he slandered Zi Xu: 'Wu Yuan appears loyal but is in substance a cruel person. He does not care for his father and elder brother. How can he care for the wang?

sentences.zh: 王前欲伐齊，員彊諫，已而有功，用是反怨王。

translations.literal: The wang before desired to attack Qi. Yuan strongly admonished. Already then there was merit. He used this to instead resent the wang.
translations.idiomatic: Earlier the king had wanted to attack Qi. Bo Pi strongly advised against it, and since the attack succeeded, he turned this into resentment against the king.

sentences.zh: 王不備伍員，員必為亂。」

translations.literal: Wang not prepare Wu Yuan, Yuan certainly causes chaos.'
translations.idiomatic: The wang is not prepared for Wu Yuan. Yuan will certainly cause chaos.'

sentences.zh: 與逢同共謀，讒之王。

translations.literal: Together with Feng Tong they plotted and slandered to the wang.
translations.idiomatic: Together with She Lü, they plotted and slandered Wu Zixu to the king.

sentences.zh: 王始不從，乃使子胥於齊，聞其託子於鮑氏，王乃大怒，曰：「伍員果欺寡人！」

translations.literal: Wang at first not followed, then sent Zi Xu to Qi, heard he entrusted son to Bao clan, wang then greatly angered, said: 'Wu Yuan indeed deceives I!'
translations.idiomatic: The wang at first did not follow. He then sent Zi Xu to Qi. He heard he entrusted his son to the Bao clan. The wang then greatly angered: 'Wu Yuan indeed deceives me!'

sentences.zh: 役反，使人賜子胥屬鏤劍以自殺。

translations.literal: The mission returned. He sent a person to grant Zi Xu a Ju Lou sword to commit suicide.
translations.idiomatic: When the mission returned, he sent someone to present Wu Zixu with a Julu sword and ordered him to commit suicide.

sentences.zh: 子胥大笑曰：「我令而父霸，我又立若，若初欲分吳國半予我，我不受，已，今若反以讒誅我。

translations.literal: Zi Xu greatly laughed said: 'I made your father hegemon, I moreover established you, you at first desired divide Wu state half give me, I not accepted, already, now you instead with slander execute me.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xu greatly laughed: 'I made your father hegemon. I moreover established you. You at first desired to divide Wu state half and give to me. I did not accept. Already now you instead execute me with slander.

sentences.zh: 嗟乎，嗟乎，一人固不能獨立！」

translations.literal: Alas, alas, one person indeed cannot stand alone!'
translations.idiomatic: Alas, alas! One person indeed cannot stand alone!'

sentences.zh: 報使者曰：「必取吾眼置吳東門，以觀越兵入也！」

translations.literal: Told envoy said: 'Certainly take my eyes place Wu east gate, to watch Yue troops enter!'
translations.idiomatic: He told the envoy: 'Certainly take my eyes and place them at Wu's east gate to watch the Yue troops enter!'

sentences.zh: 於是吳任嚭政。

translations.literal: Thereupon Wu employed Pi in governance.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Wu put state affairs in the hands of Wu Zixu.

sentences.zh: 居三年，句踐召范蠡曰：「吳已殺子胥，導諛者眾，可乎？」

translations.literal: Resided three years, Gou Jian summoned Fan Li said: 'Wu already killed Zi Xu, flattering guides many, possible?'
translations.idiomatic: After three years, Gou Jian summoned Fan Li: 'Wu has already killed Zi Xu. Flattering guides are many. Is it possible?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「未可。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Not yet possible.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Not yet possible.'

sentences.zh: 至明年春，吳王北會諸侯於黃池，吳國精兵從王，惟獨老弱與太子留守。

translations.literal: By the next year's spring, the Wu wang went north to assemble the feudal lords at Huang Chi. Wu state's elite troops followed the wang. Only the old and weak remained with the crown prince to defend.
translations.idiomatic: By the following spring, King Fuchai went north to meet the other lords at Huangchi. Wu's crack troops went with him, leaving only the old and weak with the crown prince to guard the capital.

sentences.zh: 句踐復問范蠡，蠡曰「可矣」。

translations.literal: Gou Jian again asked Fan Li, Li said 'possible.'
translations.idiomatic: Gou Jian again asked Fan Li. Li said 'possible.'

sentences.zh: 乃發習流二千人，教士四萬人，君子六千人，諸御千人，伐吳。

translations.literal: He then sent Xi Liu two thousand people, Jiao Shi forty thousand people, Jun Zi six thousand people, various charioteers one thousand people to attack Wu.
translations.idiomatic: He mobilized two thousand Xi Liu warriors, forty thousand trained soldiers, six thousand officers, and one thousand charioteers to attack Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳師敗，遂殺吳太子。

translations.literal: The Wu troops were defeated. They then killed the Wu crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: The Wu forces were defeated, and they killed the Wu crown prince.

sentences.zh: 吳告急於王，王方會諸侯於黃池，懼天下聞之，乃祕之。

translations.literal: Wu urgently informed the wang. The wang was just assembling feudal lords at Huang Chi. He feared the world would hear it and kept it secret.
translations.idiomatic: Wu sent urgent appeals to the king, who was then convening the lords at Huangchi. Fearing the world would learn of it, he kept the news secret.

sentences.zh: 吳王已盟黃池，乃使人厚禮以請成越。

translations.literal: The Wu wang had already allied at Huang Chi. He then sent a person with thick gifts to request peace with Yue.
translations.idiomatic: King Fuchai had just concluded his alliance at Huangchi. He sent envoys with rich gifts to sue for peace with Yue.

sentences.zh: 越自度亦未能滅吳，乃與吳平。

translations.literal: Yue self-measured also not able to extinguish Wu. They then made peace with Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Yue realized they were not yet strong enough to destroy Wu completely, so they agreed to peace.

sentences.zh: 其後四年，越復伐吳。

translations.literal: Four years later, Yue again attacked Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Four years later, Yue attacked Wu again.

sentences.zh: 吳士民罷弊，輕銳盡死於齊、晉。

translations.literal: Wu's officers and people were exhausted and fatigued. The light and sharp troops all died at Qi and Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Wu's soldiers and people were utterly exhausted. Its best troops had all perished in the wars against Qi and Jin.

sentences.zh: 而越大破吳，因而留圍之三年，吳師敗，越遂復棲吳王於姑蘇之山。

translations.literal: But Yue greatly broke Wu. Therefore they stayed and surrounded for three years. The Wu troops were defeated. Yue then again perched the Wu wang at Gu Su mountain.
translations.idiomatic: Yue inflicted a major defeat on Wu. They maintained the siege for three years. The Wu army was broken, and Yue once again drove King Fuchai to take refuge on Mount Gusu.

sentences.zh: 吳王使公孫雄肉袒膝行而前，請成越王曰：「孤臣夫差敢布腹心，異日嘗得罪於會稽，夫差不敢逆命，得與君王成以歸。

translations.literal: Wu wang sent Gong Sun Xiong bare flesh knee walked advanced, requested peace Yue wang said: 'Orphan minister Fu Chai dares spread abdomen heart, different day once offended at Kui Ji, Fu Chai not dare oppose command, obtain with lord wang peace to return.
translations.idiomatic: The Wu wang sent Gong Sun Xiong who bared his flesh and knee-walked forward to request peace with the Yue wang: 'Orphan minister Fu Chai dares to spread his abdomen and heart. In a different day I once offended at Kui Ji. Fu Chai does not dare oppose the command. I obtain to make peace with the lord wang and return.

sentences.zh: 今君王舉玉趾而誅孤臣，孤臣惟命是聽，意者亦欲如會稽之赦孤臣之罪乎？」

translations.literal: Now lord wang raises jade toes execute orphan minister, orphan minister only command is obeyed, perhaps also desires like Kui Ji pardon orphan minister crime?'
translations.idiomatic: Now the lord wang raises his jade toes to execute the orphan minister. The orphan minister only obeys the command. Perhaps he also desires to pardon the orphan minister's crime like at Kui Ji?'

sentences.zh: 句踐不忍，欲許之。

translations.literal: Gou Jian could not endure and desired to permit it.
translations.idiomatic: Goujian could not bear it and wanted to grant his request.

sentences.zh: 范蠡曰：「會稽之事，天以越賜吳，吳不取。

translations.literal: Fan Li said: 'Kui Ji affair, heaven with Yue granted Wu, Wu not took.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li said: 'The Kui Ji affair - heaven granted Yue to Wu, but Wu did not take it.

sentences.zh: 今天以吳賜越，越其可逆天乎？

translations.literal: Now heaven with Wu grants Yue, Yue how can oppose heaven?
translations.idiomatic: Now heaven grants Wu to Yue. How can Yue oppose heaven?

sentences.zh: 且夫君王蚤朝晏罷，非為吳邪？

translations.literal: Moreover lord wang early morning late stop, not for Wu?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover the lord wang rises early and stops late. Is it not for Wu?

sentences.zh: 謀之二十二年，一旦而棄之，可乎？

translations.literal: Plotted twenty two years, one morning abandon it, possible?
translations.idiomatic: We plotted for twenty-two years. In one morning abandon it. Is it possible?

sentences.zh: 且夫天與弗取，反受其咎。

translations.literal: Moreover heaven gives and you do not take. Instead you receive its blame.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, when Heaven offers a gift and you refuse it, you invite blame instead.

sentences.zh: 『伐柯者其則不遠』，君忘會稽之蚯？」

translations.literal: 'Cut branch one its pattern not far', lord forget Kui Ji shame?'
translations.idiomatic: 'He who cuts a branch takes the pattern not far.' Lord, do you forget the shame of Kui Ji?'

sentences.zh: 句踐曰：「吾欲聽子言，吾不忍其使者。」

translations.literal: Gou Jian said: 'I desire listen your words, I not endure his envoy.'
translations.idiomatic: Gou Jian said: 'I desire to listen to your words, but I cannot endure his envoy.'

sentences.zh: 范蠡乃鼓進兵，曰：「王已屬政於執事，使者去，不者且得罪。」

translations.literal: Fan Li then drum advanced troops, said: 'Wang already entrusted governance to servants, envoy go, not then moreover get offense.'
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li then drummed and advanced the troops: 'The wang has already entrusted governance to the servants. The envoy should go. If not, he will moreover get offense.'

sentences.zh: 吳使者泣而去。

translations.literal: The Wu envoy wept and departed.
translations.idiomatic: The Wu envoy wept and left.

sentences.zh: 句踐憐之，乃使人謂吳王曰：「吾置王甬東，君百家。」

translations.literal: Gou Jian pitied him, then sent person told Wu wang said: 'I place wang Yong east, rule hundred families.'
translations.idiomatic: Gou Jian pitied him and sent a person to tell the Wu wang: 'I will place the wang east of Yong to rule a hundred families.'

sentences.zh: 吳王謝曰：「吾老矣，不能事君王！」

translations.literal: Wu wang declined said: 'I old, cannot serve lord wang!'
translations.idiomatic: The Wu wang declined: 'I am old and cannot serve the lord wang!'

sentences.zh: 遂自殺。

translations.literal: He then committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: He then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 乃蔽其面，曰：「吾無面以見子胥也！」

translations.literal: Then covered his face, said: 'I no face to see Zi Xu!'
translations.idiomatic: He then covered his face: 'I have no face to see Zi Xu!'

sentences.zh: 越王乃葬吳王而誅太宰嚭。

translations.literal: The Yue wang then buried the Wu wang and executed Grand Administrator Pi.
translations.idiomatic: King Goujian then buried King Fuchai with honors and executed the traitorous Wu Zixu.

sentences.zh: 句踐已平吳，乃以兵北渡淮，與齊、晉諸侯會於徐州，致貢於周。

translations.literal: Gou Jian had already pacified Wu. He then crossed the Huai north with troops and assembled with the Qi and Jin feudal lords at Xu Zhou, presenting tribute to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Having pacified Wu, Goujian led his troops north across the Huai and met with the lords of Qi and Jin at Xuzhou, where he presented tribute to the Zhou king.

sentences.zh: 周元王使人賜句踐胙，命為伯。

translations.literal: Zhou Yuan Wang sent a person to grant Gou Jian blessing meat and commanded him as Bo.
translations.idiomatic: King Yuan of Zhou sent envoys to bestow sacrificial meat upon Goujian and recognize him as Hegemon.

sentences.zh: 句踐已去，渡淮南，以淮上地與楚，歸吳所侵宋地於宋，與魯泗東方百里。

translations.literal: Gou Jian had already departed. He crossed south of the Huai, gave the land above the Huai to Chu, returned the land Wu had invaded from Song to Song, and gave Lu a hundred li east of the Si.
translations.idiomatic: On his return journey, crossing south of the Huai, he ceded lands north of the Huai to Chu, restored to Song the territories Wu had seized, and granted Lu a hundred li of land east of the Si River.

sentences.zh: 當是時，越兵橫行於江、淮東，諸侯畢賀，號稱霸王。

translations.literal: At this time, Yue troops rampaged east of the Jiang and Huai. All the feudal lords congratulated him. He was named hegemon wang.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Yue's armies marched unchallenged east of the Yangtze and Huai Rivers. All the feudal lords offered their congratulations, and he was acclaimed as Hegemon King.

sentences.zh: 范蠡遂去，自齊遺大夫種書曰：「蜚鳥盡，良弓藏；

translations.literal: Fan Li then departed, from Qi sent grandee Zhong letter said: 'Flying birds exhausted, good bow hidden;
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li then departed. From Qi he sent Grandee Zhong a letter: 'Flying birds exhausted, good bow hidden;

sentences.zh: 狡兔死，走狗烹。

translations.literal: Cunning rabbit dead, running dog cooked.
translations.idiomatic: When the cunning hare is dead, the running hound is boiled.

sentences.zh: 越王為人長頸鳥喙，可與共患難，不可與共樂。

translations.literal: The Yue wang as a person has a long neck and bird beak. He can share hardship and difficulty, but cannot share joy.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yue has a long neck and a beak-like nose. He can share adversity but not prosperity.

sentences.zh: 子何不去？」

translations.literal: You why not go?'
translations.idiomatic: Why don't you go?'

sentences.zh: 種見書，稱病不朝。

translations.literal: Zhong saw the letter and claimed illness without attending court.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Zhong read the letter and feigned illness to avoid court.

sentences.zh: 人或讒種且作亂，越王乃賜種劍曰：「子教寡人伐吳七術，寡人用其三而敗吳，其四在子，子為我從先王試之。」

translations.literal: People or slandered Zhong moreover cause chaos, Yue wang then granted Zhong sword said: 'You taught I attack Wu seven strategies, I used its three defeated Wu, its four in you, you for me follow former wang try it.'
translations.idiomatic: People slandered that Zhong would moreover cause chaos. The Yue wang then granted Zhong a sword: 'You taught me seven strategies to attack Wu. I used three of them and defeated Wu. The four remain in you. You follow the former wang and try it for me.'

sentences.zh: 種遂自殺。

translations.literal: Zhong then committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Zhong then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 句踐卒，子王鼫與立。

translations.literal: Gou Jian died. His son Wang Shu Yu was established.
translations.idiomatic: Goujian died. His son Wang Zhuyu ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 王鼫與卒，子王不壽立。

translations.literal: Wang Shu Yu died. His son Wang Bu Shou was established.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Zhuyu died. His son Wang Bushou ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 王不壽卒，子王翁立。

translations.literal: Wang Bu Shou died. His son Wang Weng was established.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Bushou died. His son Wang Weng ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 王翁卒，子王翳立。

translations.literal: Wang Weng died. His son Wang Yi was established.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Weng died. His son Wang Yi ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 王翳卒，子王之侯立。

translations.literal: Wang Yi died. His son Wang Zhi Hou was established.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Yi died. His son Wang Zhihou ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 王之侯卒，子王無彊立。

translations.literal: Wang Zhi Hou died. His son Wang Wu Qiang was established.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Zhihou died. His son Wang Wuqiang ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 王無彊時，越興師北伐齊，西伐楚，與中國爭彊。

translations.literal: During Wang Wu Qiang's time, Yue raised troops to attack Qi north and Chu west, contending for strength with the Central Plains.
translations.idiomatic: During Wang Wuqiang's reign, Yue raised armies to attack Qi to the north and Chu to the west, contending for supremacy with the states of the Central Plains.

sentences.zh: 當楚威王之時，越北伐齊，齊威王使人說越王曰：「越不伐楚，大不王，小不伯。

translations.literal: At Chu Wei Wang time, Yue north attacked Qi, Qi Wei Wang sent person persuaded Yue wang said: 'Yue not attack Chu, great not wang, small not bo.
translations.idiomatic: During Chu Wei Wang's time, Yue attacked Qi to the north. Qi Wei Wang sent a person to persuade the Yue wang: 'If Yue does not attack Chu, it will not be great as wang or small as bo.

sentences.zh: 圖越之所為不伐楚者，為不得晉也。

translations.literal: Consider what Yue does by not attacking Chu - it is because it cannot obtain Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Consider why Yue refrains from attacking Chu—it is because they cannot secure Jin's alliance.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏固不攻楚。

translations.literal: Han and Wei certainly will not attack Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei will certainly not attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 韓之攻楚，覆其軍，殺其將，則葉、陽翟危；

translations.literal: Han attack Chu, overturn its army, kill its general, then Ye, Yang Di dangerous;
translations.idiomatic: If Han attacks Chu, overturns its army, and kills its general, then Ye and Yang Di will be in danger;

sentences.zh: 魏亦覆其軍，殺其將，則陳、上蔡不安。

translations.literal: If Wei also overturns its army and kills its general, then Chen and Shang Cai will not be peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: If Wei also suffers defeat and loses its general, then Chen and Shangcai will be imperiled.

sentences.zh: 故二晉之事越也，不至於覆軍殺將，馬汗之力不效。

translations.literal: Therefore the two Jin serving Yue will not reach overturning armies and killing generals. The effort of horse sweat will not be effective.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the two Jin states serving Yue will not go so far as to suffer army defeats and general deaths. The toil of their warhorses will prove ineffective.

sentences.zh: 所重於得晉者何也？」

translations.literal: What value in obtaining Jin?'
translations.idiomatic: What value is there in obtaining Jin?'

sentences.zh: 越王曰：「所求於晉者，不至頓刃接兵，而況于攻城圍邑乎？

translations.literal: Yue wang said: 'What seek from Jin, not reach clash blades connect troops, moreover attack cities surround towns?
translations.idiomatic: The Yue wang said: 'What is sought from Jin does not reach clashing blades and connecting troops, moreover attacking cities and surrounding towns?

sentences.zh: 願魏以聚大梁之下，願齊之試兵南陽莒地，以聚常、郯之境，則方城之外不南，淮、泗之閒不東，商、於、析、酈、宗胡之地，夏路以左，不足以備秦，江南、泗上不足以待越矣。

translations.literal: I wish Wei to gather below Da Liang. I wish Qi to test troops in Nan Yang and Ju lands to gather at the Chang and Tan borders. Then outside Fang Cheng will not go south. Between Huai and Si will not go east. The lands of Shang, Yu, Xi, Li, and Zong Hu, left of the Xia road, will not be sufficient to prepare for Qin. Jiang Nan and Si Shang will not be sufficient to await Yue.
translations.idiomatic: I wish Wei to concentrate forces south of Daliang, and Qi to deploy troops in the Nanyang and Ju regions, gathering at the borders of Chang and Tan. Then the lands beyond Fangcheng will not extend southward, the regions between Huai and Si will not extend eastward. The territories of Shang, Yu, Xi, Li, and Zonghu west of the Xia road will be insufficient to defend against Qin, while the lands south of the Yangtze and north of the Si will be inadequate to resist Yue.

sentences.zh: 則齊、秦、韓、魏得志於楚也，是二晉不戰分地，不耕而穫之。

translations.literal: Then Qi, Qin, Han, and Wei will obtain their ambitions at Chu. This is the two Jin dividing land without battle, harvesting without plowing.
translations.idiomatic: Then Qi, Qin, Han, and Wei will achieve their ambitions against Chu. This means the two Jin states will divide Chu's territory without fighting, reaping without sowing.

sentences.zh: 不此之為，而頓刃於河山之閒以為齊秦用，所待者如此其失計，柰何其以此王也！」

translations.literal: Not this do, but clash blades at river mountains between as Qi Qin use, what await thus its mistaken plan, how this with wang!'
translations.idiomatic: Not doing this, but clashing blades between rivers and mountains to be used by Qi and Qin. What is awaited is thus its mistaken plan. How can one wang with this!'

sentences.zh: 齊使者曰：「幸也越之不亡也！

translations.literal: Qi envoy said: 'Fortunate Yue not perished!
translations.idiomatic: The Qi envoy said: 'Fortunate that Yue has not perished!

sentences.zh: 吾不貴其用智之如目，見豪毛而不見其睫也。

translations.literal: I do not value its use of wisdom like eyes, seeing fine hairs but not seeing its eyelashes.
translations.idiomatic: I do not value wisdom that is like eyes—seeing the finest hairs but missing the eyelashes right before them.

sentences.zh: 今王知晉之失計，而不自知越之過，是目論也。

translations.literal: Now the wang knows Jin's mistaken plan, but does not know Yue's own excess. This is eye discussion.
translations.idiomatic: Now you, my king, recognize Jin's strategic errors but fail to see Yue's own shortcomings. This is mere superficial observation.

sentences.zh: 王所待於晉者，非有馬汗之力也，又非可與合軍連和也，將待之以分楚眾也。

translations.literal: What the wang awaits from Jin is not horse sweat strength, nor can it combine armies and connect in harmony. He will await using it to divide Chu's masses.
translations.idiomatic: What you expect from Jin is neither military might nor the ability to coordinate armies. You merely hope to use them to divide Chu's forces.

sentences.zh: 今楚眾已分，何待於晉？」

translations.literal: Now Chu masses already divided, what await from Jin?'
translations.idiomatic: Now Chu's masses are already divided. What is there to await from Jin?'

sentences.zh: 越王曰：「柰何？」

translations.literal: Yue wang said: 'What to do?'
translations.idiomatic: The Yue wang said: 'What is to be done?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「楚三大夫張九軍，北圍曲沃、於中，以至無假之關者三千七百里，景翠之軍北聚魯、齊、南陽，分有大此者乎？

translations.literal: Said: 'Chu three grandees spread nine armies, north surround Qu Wo, Yu Zhong, to Wu Jia pass three thousand seven hundred li, Jing Cui army north gather Lu, Qi, Nan Yang, divide have larger this?
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Chu's three grandees have spread nine armies, surrounding Qu Wo and Yu Zhong to the north, reaching three thousand seven hundred li to Wu Jia pass. Jing Cui's army gathers north at Lu, Qi, and Nan Yang. Is there division larger than this?

sentences.zh: 且王之所求者，鬬晉楚也；

translations.literal: Moreover wang what seeks, fight Jin Chu;
translations.idiomatic: Moreover what the wang seeks is to fight Jin and Chu;

sentences.zh: 晉楚不鬬，越兵不起，是知二五而不知十也。

translations.literal: If Jin and Chu do not fight, Yue troops will not rise. This is knowing two and five but not knowing ten.
translations.idiomatic: If Jin and Chu do not clash, Yue will not mobilize. This is like knowing that two plus five equals seven, but missing that it could be ten.

sentences.zh: 此時不攻楚，臣以是知越大不王，小不伯。

translations.literal: If at this time Chu is not attacked, the minister knows Yue will not be great as wang or small as bo.
translations.idiomatic: If we do not attack Chu at this moment, I know Yue will achieve neither kingship nor hegemony.

sentences.zh: 復讎、龐、長沙，楚之粟也；

translations.literal: Fu Qiu, Pang, Chang Sha, Chu grain;
translations.idiomatic: Fu Qiu, Pang, and Chang Sha are Chu's grain;

sentences.zh: 竟澤陵，楚之材也。

translations.literal: Jing Ze Ling is Chu's timber.
translations.idiomatic: Jingzelin is Chu's source of timber.

sentences.zh: 越窺兵通無假之關，此四邑者不上貢事於郢矣。

translations.literal: If Yue's spy troops connect to Wu Jia pass, these four cities will not tribute and serve Ying.
translations.idiomatic: If Yue's advance troops reach Wujia Pass, these four cities will cease paying tribute and serving Ying.

sentences.zh: 臣聞之，圖王不王，其敝可以伯。

translations.literal: I have heard that planning to wang but not wanging, its damage can still be bo.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that one who aspires to kingship but falls short may still achieve hegemony.

sentences.zh: 然而不伯者，王道失也。

translations.literal: However not being bo means the wang way is lost.
translations.idiomatic: But failing even at hegemony means the royal way is lost.

sentences.zh: 故願大王之轉攻楚也。」

translations.literal: Therefore wish great wang turn attack Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore I wish the great wang to turn and attack Chu.'

sentences.zh: 於是越遂釋齊而伐楚。

translations.literal: Thereupon Yue then released Qi and attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Yue abandoned Qi and attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚威王興兵而伐之，大敗越，殺王無彊，盡取笔吳地至浙江，北破齊於徐州。

translations.literal: Chu Wei Wang raised troops and attacked it. He greatly defeated Yue, killed Wang Wu Qiang, took all the Bi Wu lands to Zhe Jiang, and north broke Qi at Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: King Wei of Chu raised an army and counterattacked. He decisively defeated Yue, killed King Wuqiang, seized all the former Wu territories as far as the Zhe River, and to the north defeated Qi at Xuzhou.

sentences.zh: 而越以此散，諸族子爭立，或為王，或為君，濱於江南海上，服朝於楚。

translations.literal: But Yue scattered with this. The various clan sons contended to establish themselves, some as wang, some as jun. They bordered the Jiang Nan seashore and submitted to court Chu.
translations.idiomatic: With this defeat, Yue fragmented. Various clan descendants contended for power, some styling themselves kings, others lords. They clung to the southeastern seaboard and paid court to Chu.

sentences.zh: 後七世，至閩君搖，佐諸侯平秦。

translations.literal: After seven generations, it reached Min Jun Yao, who assisted the feudal lords to pacify Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Seven generations later, it came to Lord Yao of Min, who aided the feudal lords in pacifying Qin.

sentences.zh: 漢高帝復以搖為越王，以奉越後。

translations.literal: Han Gao Di again made Yao the Yue wang to serve the Yue descendants.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu of Han once again installed Yao as King of Yue to maintain the Yue royal line.

sentences.zh: 東越，閩君，皆其後也。

translations.literal: East Yue and Min Jun are all their descendants.
translations.idiomatic: Eastern Yue and the Lord of Min were all descendants of this line.

sentences.zh: 范蠡事越王句踐，既苦身力，與句踐深謀二十餘年，竟滅吳，報會稽之恥，北渡兵於淮以臨齊、晉，號令中國，以尊周室，句踐以霸，而范蠡稱上將軍。

translations.literal: Fan Li served Yue wang Gou Jian. He already tormented his body and strength, deeply planned with Gou Jian for more than twenty years, finally extinguished Wu, repaid the Kui Ji shame, crossed troops north at the Huai to face Qi and Jin, commanded the Central Plains to honor the Zhou chamber. Gou Jian achieved hegemony, and Fan Li was called the upper general.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li served King Goujian of Yue. He endured hardship and toil, plotting deeply with Goujian for more than twenty years. They finally destroyed Wu and avenged the humiliation of Mount Kuaiji. Fan Li led troops north across the Huai to confront Qi and Jin, issued commands throughout the Central Plains to honor the Zhou house. Goujian achieved hegemony, and Fan Li was hailed as Supreme Commander.

sentences.zh: 還反國，范蠡以為大名之下，難以久居，且句踐為人可與同患，難與處安，為書辭句踐曰：「臣聞主憂臣勞，主辱臣死。

translations.literal: Returned country, Fan Li thought great name below, difficult long reside, moreover Gou Jian as person can with share hardship, difficult with dwell peace, made letter resign Gou Jian said: 'Minister heard lord worry minister toil, lord humiliate minister die.
translations.idiomatic: He returned to the country. Fan Li thought that under great name it was difficult to reside long. Moreover Gou Jian as a person could share hardship but was difficult to dwell in peace with. He made a letter to resign from Gou Jian: 'I have heard that when the lord worries, the minister toils; when the lord is humiliated, the minister dies.

sentences.zh: 昔者君王辱於會稽，所以不死，為此事也。

translations.literal: Formerly the lord wang was humiliated at Kui Ji. The reason I did not die was for this affair.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly my lord suffered humiliation at Mount Kuaiji. The reason I did not die was to accomplish this very thing.

sentences.zh: 今既以雪恥，臣請從會稽之誅。」

translations.literal: Now already snowed shame, minister request follow Kui Ji execution.'
translations.idiomatic: Now that shame has been avenged, the minister requests to follow the Kui Ji execution.'

sentences.zh: 句踐曰：「孤將與子分國而有之。

translations.literal: Gou Jian said: 'I will with you divide state possess it.
translations.idiomatic: Gou Jian said: 'I will divide the state with you and possess it.

sentences.zh: 不然，將加誅于子。」

translations.literal: Not so, will add execution to you.'
translations.idiomatic: If not, I will add execution to you.'

sentences.zh: 范蠡曰：「君行令，臣行意。」

translations.literal: Fan Li said: 'Lord execute commands, minister execute intentions.'
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li said: 'The lord executes commands, the minister executes intentions.'

sentences.zh: 乃裝其輕寶珠玉，自與其私徒屬乘舟浮海以行，終不反。

translations.literal: He then packed his light treasures of pearls and jade, himself with his private followers rode a boat and floated on the sea to go. He finally did not return.
translations.idiomatic: He packed his portable treasures of pearls and jade, took his personal retinue, boarded a boat, and sailed away across the sea. He never returned.

sentences.zh: 於是句踐表會稽山以為范蠡奉邑。

translations.literal: Thereupon Gou Jian inscribed Kui Ji mountain as Fan Li's service city.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Goujian inscribed Mount Kuaiji as Fan Li's fief in recognition of his service.

sentences.zh: 范蠡浮海出齊，變姓名，自謂鴟夷子皮，耕于海畔，苦身戮力，父子治產。

translations.literal: Fan Li floated on the sea and exited to Qi. He changed his name and called himself Chi Yi Zi Pi. He farmed at the seashore, tormented his body and exerted strength. Father and son managed property.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li sailed to Qi, changed his name, and called himself Master Chi Yi Zi Pi. He farmed along the seacoast, working tirelessly with his family to build their estate.

sentences.zh: 居無幾何，致產數十萬。

translations.literal: He resided not long before obtaining property of several tens of thousands.
translations.idiomatic: Before long, he had amassed a fortune worth hundreds of thousands.

sentences.zh: 齊人聞其賢，以為相。

translations.literal: The Qi people heard of his worth and made him prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi heard of his worth and appointed him prime minister.

sentences.zh: 范蠡喟然嘆曰：「居家則致千金，居官則至卿相，此布衣之極也。

translations.literal: Fan Li sighed said: 'Reside home then obtain thousand gold, reside office then reach minister chancellor, this commoner extreme.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li sighed: 'Residing at home obtains a thousand gold. Residing in office reaches minister chancellor. This is the commoner's extreme.

sentences.zh: 久受尊名，不祥。」

translations.literal: Long receive honored name, not auspicious.'
translations.idiomatic: Long receiving honored name is not auspicious.'

sentences.zh: 乃歸相印，盡散其財，以分與知友鄉黨，而懷其重寶，閒行以去，止于陶，以為此天下之中，交易有無之路通，為生可以致富矣。

translations.literal: He then returned the prime minister seal and completely scattered his wealth to divide with known friends and village parties. But he carried his heavy treasures and secretly went away, stopping at Tao. He thought this was the world's center where trade and commerce roads connected, and doing business could make one rich.
translations.idiomatic: He returned his seal of office and distributed all his wealth among friends and neighbors. But he kept his most valuable treasures, traveled incognito, and settled in Tao. He saw it as the center of the world, where trade routes converged and commerce could bring great wealth.

sentences.zh: 於是自謂陶朱公。

translations.literal: Thereupon he called himself Tao Zhu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he took the name Lord Tao Zhu.

sentences.zh: 復約要父子耕畜，廢居，候時轉物，逐什一之利。

translations.literal: He again made an agreement with father and son to farm livestock and empty the residence, await the time to circulate goods, and pursue ten percent profit.
translations.idiomatic: Once more he and his son agreed to farm livestock and leave their home empty, waiting for the right moment to trade goods and pursue ten percent profits.

sentences.zh: 居無何，則致貲累巨萬。

translations.literal: He resided not long before obtaining wealth that accumulated to great tens of thousands.
translations.idiomatic: Before long, his wealth had grown to vast amounts.

sentences.zh: 天下稱陶朱公。

translations.literal: The world called him Tao Zhu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Throughout the world he was known as Lord Tao Zhu.

sentences.zh: 朱公居陶，生少子。

translations.literal: Zhu Gong resided in Tao and gave birth to a young son.
translations.idiomatic: While residing in Tao, Lord Zhu had a younger son.

sentences.zh: 少子及壯，而朱公中男殺人，囚於楚。

translations.literal: The young son reached adulthood, but Zhu Gong's middle son killed a person and was imprisoned in Chu.
translations.idiomatic: When his youngest son came of age, Lord Zhu's middle son killed a man and was imprisoned in Chu.

sentences.zh: 朱公曰：「殺人而死，職也。

translations.literal: Zhu Gong said: 'Kill person die, duty.
translations.idiomatic: Zhu Gong said: 'To kill a person and die is duty.

sentences.zh: 然吾聞千金之子不死於市。」

translations.literal: However I heard thousand gold son not die at market.'
translations.idiomatic: However I have heard that a thousand gold son's son does not die at the market.'

sentences.zh: 告其少子往視之。

translations.literal: He told his young son to go see him.
translations.idiomatic: He instructed his youngest son to go visit him.

sentences.zh: 乃裝黃金千溢，置褐器中，載以一牛車。

translations.literal: He then packed a thousand yi of yellow gold, placed it in a coarse vessel, and loaded it with one ox cart.
translations.idiomatic: He packed a thousand yi of gold, concealed it in a coarse container, and loaded it onto an ox cart.

sentences.zh: 且遣其少子，朱公長男固請欲行，朱公不聽。

translations.literal: He moreover sent his young son. Zhu Gong's eldest son firmly requested to go, but Zhu Gong did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He sent his youngest son. Lord Zhu's eldest son insisted on going himself, but Lord Zhu refused.

sentences.zh: 長男曰：「家有長子曰家督，今弟有罪，大人不遣，乃遺少弟，是吾不肖。」

translations.literal: Eldest male said: 'Family has eldest son called family supervisor, now younger brother has crime, great person not send, then send young brother, this my unworthy.'
translations.idiomatic: The eldest son said: 'The family has an eldest son called the family supervisor. Now the younger brother has crime. The great person does not send me, but sends the young brother. This makes me unworthy.'

sentences.zh: 欲自殺。

translations.literal: He desired to commit suicide.
translations.idiomatic: He threatened suicide.

sentences.zh: 其母為言曰：「今遣少子，未必能生中子也，而先空亡長男，柰何？」

translations.literal: His mother for spoke said: 'Now send young son, perhaps not able save middle son, but first vainly lose eldest male, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: His mother spoke for him: 'Now sending the young son may not be able to save the middle son, but first vainly losing the eldest male. What is to be done?'

sentences.zh: 朱公不得已而遣長子，為一封書遺故所善莊生。

translations.literal: Zhu Gong had no choice but to send the eldest son. He made one sealed letter to send to his former friend Zhuang Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Zhu had no choice but to send his eldest son, along with a sealed letter to his old friend Zhuang Sheng.

sentences.zh: 曰：「至則進千金于莊生所，聽其所為，慎無與爭事。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Arrive then advance thousand gold at Zhuang Sheng place, listen his doings, careful not with contend affairs.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'When you arrive, advance a thousand gold at Zhuang Sheng's place. Listen to what he does. Be careful not to contend in affairs.'

sentences.zh: 長男既行，亦自私齎數百金。

translations.literal: The eldest son already went. He also privately carried several hundred gold himself.
translations.idiomatic: The eldest son departed, but secretly brought several hundred gold pieces of his own.

sentences.zh: 至楚，莊生家負郭，披藜藋到門，居甚貧。

translations.literal: He arrived in Chu. Zhuang Sheng's home backed the outer wall. He brushed through thorns and thistles to the door. He resided very poorly.
translations.idiomatic: Upon arriving in Chu, he found Zhuang Sheng's home outside the city walls. He had to push through thorns and brambles to reach the door. Zhuang Sheng lived in dire poverty.

sentences.zh: 然長男發書進千金，如其父言。

translations.literal: However the eldest son opened the letter and advanced a thousand gold, as his father said.
translations.idiomatic: The eldest son opened the letter and presented the thousand gold pieces as instructed.

sentences.zh: 莊生曰：「可疾去矣，慎毋留！

translations.literal: Zhuang Sheng said: 'Can quickly go, careful not stay!
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Sheng said: 'You can quickly go. Be careful not to stay!

sentences.zh: 即弟出，勿問所以然。」

translations.literal: When younger brother released, not ask reason.'
translations.idiomatic: When the younger brother is released, do not ask the reason.'

sentences.zh: 長男既去，不過莊生而私留，以其私齎獻遺楚國貴人用事者。

translations.literal: The eldest son already went. He did not pass Zhuang Sheng but privately stayed, offering and presenting what he privately carried to Chu state's nobles who handled affairs.
translations.idiomatic: The eldest son left Zhuang Sheng's house but lingered in the city, using his private funds to bribe influential nobles in Chu.

sentences.zh: 莊生雖居窮閻，然以廉直聞於國，自楚王以下皆師尊之。

translations.literal: Zhuang Sheng though resided in a poor alley, however he was heard in the state for incorruptibility and straightness. From the Chu wang below, all honored him as teacher.
translations.idiomatic: Though Zhuang Sheng lived in a poor alley, his integrity and uprightness were renowned throughout Chu. From the king downward, all honored him as their teacher.

sentences.zh: 及朱公進金，非有意受也，欲以成事後復歸之以為信耳。

translations.literal: When Zhu Gong advanced the gold, he did not intentionally receive it. He desired to complete the affairs and then return it as trust.
translations.idiomatic: When Lord Zhu offered the gold, Zhuang Sheng had no intention of keeping it. He merely wished to complete the task and return it to demonstrate his trustworthiness.

sentences.zh: 故金至，謂其婦曰：「此朱公之金。

translations.literal: Therefore gold arrived, told his wife said: 'This Zhu Gong gold.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore when the gold arrived, he told his wife: 'This is Zhu Gong's gold.

sentences.zh: 有如病不宿誡，後復歸，勿動。」

translations.literal: If like illness not overnight cured, later again return, not move.'
translations.idiomatic: If it is like an illness not cured overnight, later it will again return. Do not move it.'

sentences.zh: 而朱公長男不知其意，以為殊無短長也。

translations.literal: But Zhu Gong's eldest son did not know his intention. He thought there was especially no advantage.
translations.idiomatic: But Lord Zhu's eldest son misunderstood Zhuang Sheng's intentions, thinking he saw no point in the scheme.

sentences.zh: 莊生閒時入見楚王，言「某星宿某，此則害於楚」。

translations.literal: Zhuang Sheng leisure time entered saw Chu wang, spoke 'some star lodges some, this then harms Chu'.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Sheng in his leisure time entered and saw the Chu wang. He spoke: 'Some star lodges in some position. This then harms Chu.'

sentences.zh: 楚王素信莊生，曰：「今為柰何？」

translations.literal: Chu wang usually trusted Zhuang Sheng, said: 'Now what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu wang usually trusted Zhuang Sheng. He said: 'What is to be done now?'

sentences.zh: 莊生曰：「獨以德為可以除之。」

translations.literal: Zhuang Sheng said: 'Only with virtue can remove it.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Sheng said: 'Only with virtue can it be removed.'

sentences.zh: 楚王曰：「生休矣，寡人將行之。」

translations.literal: Chu wang said: 'Sheng rest, I will carry it out.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu wang said: 'Sheng, rest. I will carry it out.'

sentences.zh: 王乃使使者封三錢之府。

translations.literal: The wang then sent an envoy to seal the three money treasuries.
translations.idiomatic: The king sent officials to seal the three treasuries.

sentences.zh: 楚貴人驚告朱公長男曰：「王且赦。」

translations.literal: Chu nobles alarmed told Zhu Gong eldest male said: 'Wang about to pardon.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu nobles were alarmed and told Zhu Gong's eldest son: 'The wang is about to pardon.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「何以也？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Why?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「每王且赦，常封三錢之府。

translations.literal: Said: 'Whenever wang about to pardon, always seals three money treasuries.
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Whenever the wang is about to pardon, he always seals the three money treasuries.

sentences.zh: 昨暮王使使封之。」

translations.literal: Last evening wang sent envoy sealed them.'
translations.idiomatic: Last evening the wang sent an envoy to seal them.'

sentences.zh: 朱公長男以為赦，弟固當出也，重千金虛棄莊生，無所為也，乃復見莊生。

translations.literal: Zhu Gong's eldest son thought it was a pardon. His younger brother certainly should be released. He valued the thousand gold and vainly abandoned Zhuang Sheng. There was no purpose. He then again saw Zhuang Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Zhu's eldest son believed it was a pardon and his brother would surely be released. He regretted wasting a thousand gold pieces on Zhuang Sheng for no purpose, so he returned to see him again.

sentences.zh: 莊生驚曰：「若不去邪？」

translations.literal: Zhuang Sheng startled said: 'You not go?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Sheng was startled: 'You did not go?'

sentences.zh: 長男曰：「固未也。

translations.literal: Eldest male said: 'Certainly not yet.
translations.idiomatic: The eldest son said: 'Certainly not yet.

sentences.zh: 初為事弟，弟今議自赦，故辭生去。」

translations.literal: Initially for younger brother affair, younger brother now perhaps self-pardoned, therefore bid farewell Sheng go.'
translations.idiomatic: Initially for the younger brother's affair, the younger brother now perhaps pardoned himself. Therefore I bid farewell to Sheng and go.'

sentences.zh: 莊生知其意欲復得其金，曰：「若自入室取金。」

translations.literal: Zhuang Sheng knew his intention desired again obtain his gold, said: 'You self enter room take gold.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Sheng knew his intention was to again obtain his gold. He said: 'You yourself enter the room and take the gold.'

sentences.zh: 長男即自入室取金持去，獨自歡幸。

translations.literal: The eldest son immediately himself entered the room, took the gold, and departed holding it. He alone rejoiced in his good fortune.
translations.idiomatic: The eldest son slipped into Zhuang Sheng's room, took the gold, and left, congratulating himself on his cleverness.

sentences.zh: 莊生羞為兒子所賣，乃入見楚王曰：「臣前言某星事，王言欲以修德報之。

translations.literal: Zhuang Sheng ashamed for son sold, then entered saw Chu wang said: 'Minister before spoke some star affair, wang said desired with cultivate virtue respond it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Sheng was ashamed to be sold by the son. He then entered and saw the Chu wang: 'I previously spoke of some star affair. The wang said he desired to respond with cultivating virtue.

sentences.zh: 今臣出，道路皆言陶之富人朱公之子殺人囚楚，其家多持金錢賂王左右，故王非能恤楚國而赦，乃以朱公子故也。」

translations.literal: Now minister out, roads all say Tao rich person Zhu Gong son killed person imprisoned Chu, his family much held gold money bribed wang attendants, therefore wang not able sympathize Chu state pardon, but with Zhu Gong son reason.'
translations.idiomatic: Now when I went out, the roads all said Tao's rich person Zhu Gong's son killed and was imprisoned in Chu. His family held much gold and money to bribe the wang's attendants. Therefore the wang did not sympathize with Chu state and pardon, but because of Zhu Gong's son.'

sentences.zh: 楚王大怒曰：「寡人雖不德耳，柰何以朱公之子故而施惠乎！」

translations.literal: Chu wang greatly angered said: 'I though not virtuous, how with Zhu Gong son reason apply favor!'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu wang was greatly angered: 'Though I am not virtuous, how can I apply favor because of Zhu Gong's son!'

sentences.zh: 令論殺朱公子，明日遂下赦令。

translations.literal: He commanded that Zhu Gong's son be judged and killed. The next day he then issued a pardon order.
translations.idiomatic: The king ordered Lord Zhu's imprisoned son executed. The next day he issued a general pardon.

sentences.zh: 朱公長男竟持其弟喪歸。

translations.literal: Zhu Gong's eldest son finally held his younger brother's funeral and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Zhu's eldest son returned home carrying his brother's ashes for burial.

sentences.zh: 至，其母及邑人盡哀之，唯朱公獨笑，曰：「吾固知必殺其弟也！

translations.literal: Arrived, his mother and city people all grieved him, only Zhu Gong alone laughed, said: 'I certainly knew would kill his younger brother!
translations.idiomatic: He arrived. His mother and the city people all grieved for him. Only Zhu Gong alone laughed: 'I certainly knew he would kill his younger brother!

sentences.zh: 彼非不愛其弟，顧有所不能忍者也。

translations.literal: He did not not love his younger brother, but there was something he could not endure.
translations.idiomatic: He loved his brother dearly, but there was one thing he could not bear.

sentences.zh: 是少與我俱，見苦，為生難，故重棄財。

translations.literal: When he was young he was with me. He saw hardship and living was difficult. Therefore he valued abandoning wealth.
translations.idiomatic: He grew up with me in poverty, witnessed hardship, and knows how difficult it is to earn a living. That is why he values wealth too highly to squander.

sentences.zh: 至如少弟者，生而見我富，乘堅驅良逐狡兔，豈知財所從來，故輕棄之，非所惜吝。

translations.literal: As for the young younger brother, born seeing me rich, riding firm and driving good to pursue cunning rabbits. How did he know where wealth came from? Therefore he lightly abandoned it. It was not what he cherished and was stingy about.
translations.idiomatic: As for my youngest son, he was born into wealth, rides fine carriages drawn by good horses to hunt cunning rabbits. How would he know the hardships of acquiring wealth? That is why he squanders it so lightly—it means nothing to him.

sentences.zh: 前日吾所為欲遣少子，固為其能棄財故也。

translations.literal: The previous days what I did in desiring to send the young son was certainly because of his ability to abandon wealth.
translations.idiomatic: That is why I insisted on sending my youngest son—because he has the wisdom to use wealth when necessary.

sentences.zh: 而長者不能，故卒以殺其弟，事之理也，無足悲者。

translations.literal: But the elder was not able. Therefore he finally killed his younger brother. It is the principle of affairs. Nothing worth grieving.
translations.idiomatic: But the eldest lacked this wisdom, and so doomed his brother. Such is the logic of human affairs—nothing to grieve over.

sentences.zh: 吾日夜固以望其喪之來也。」

translations.literal: I day night certainly expected his funeral come.'
translations.idiomatic: Day and night I certainly expected his funeral to come.'

sentences.zh: 故范蠡三徙，成名於天下，非茍去而已，所止必成名。

translations.literal: Therefore Fan Li in three moves achieved fame in the world. He did not casually depart only. Wherever he stopped he certainly achieved fame.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Fan Li's three migrations brought him fame throughout the world. He did not leave idly—wherever he settled, he achieved renown.

sentences.zh: 卒老死于陶，故世傳曰陶朱公。

translations.literal: He finally aged and died in Tao. Therefore the world transmitted Tao Zhu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He lived out his days and died in Tao, which is why the world remembers him as Lord Tao Zhu.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：禹之功大矣，漸九川，定九州，至于今諸夏艾安。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Yu merit great, regulated nine rivers, settled nine provinces, until now various Xia peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: Yu's merit was great. He regulated the nine rivers and settled the nine provinces. Until now the various Xia are peaceful.

sentences.zh: 及苗裔句踐，苦身焦思，終滅彊吳，北觀兵中國，以尊周室，號稱霸王。

translations.literal: And the descendant Gou Jian tormented his body with worried thoughts. He finally extinguished strong Wu, displayed troops north in the Central Plains, honored the Zhou chamber, and was named hegemon wang.
translations.idiomatic: As for his descendant Goujian, he endured hardship and deep thought, finally destroying mighty Wu. He marched north to display his troops in the Central Plains, honored the Zhou house, and was acclaimed as Hegemon King.

sentences.zh: 句踐可不謂賢哉！

translations.literal: Gou Jian can not be called worthy!
translations.idiomatic: Gou Jian can certainly be called worthy!

sentences.zh: 蓋有禹之遺烈焉。

translations.literal: Indeed he has Yu's remaining illustrious deeds.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, he carried on the illustrious legacy of Yu.

sentences.zh: 范蠡三遷皆有榮名，名垂後世。

translations.literal: Fan Li's three moves all had glorious names. Names hung for later generations.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Li's three migrations each brought him glorious fame, his name enduring for posterity.

sentences.zh: 臣主若此，欲毋顯得乎！

translations.literal: Minister lord like this, desired not manifest obtained!
translations.idiomatic: Minister and lord like this. How could they not manifestly obtain!
